active_learning.discussion_prompt: In small groups, debate the following: 'In high-stakes incident response environments, is structured mentoring more effective than informal shadowing for building forensics skills? Support your position with examples of technical (e.g., forensic tools) and soft skills (e.g., communication under pressure), and consider challenges like time constraints during active incidents.' Encourage critical thinking by requiring groups to reference NICE Framework KSAs.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Incident Response and Forensics. Generate 40-50 high-quality flashcards on 'Mentoring and Shadowing Programs' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 002_Incident Response And Forensics > 002_Incident Response Team Organization > 009_Skills and Training > Training Programs > Mentoring and Shadowing Programs). Use the provided learning_objectives, active_learning activities, scaffolding layers, and flashcard_schema EXACTLY. Context: These programs bridge the talent gap via mentorship (guidance from experts) and shadowing (observational training). Focus on technical skills (forensic tools, incident handling), soft skills (communication), best practices (matching, feedback, evaluation), and alignment with NICE Framework KSAs/CISA. Sources: NICE Framework (nist.gov/itl/applied-cybersecurity/nice), CISA workforce resources. Incorporate pedagogy: Bloom's progression, active learning hooks (e.g., reference discussion scenarios in explanations), 4-layer scaffolding. Output ONLY a JSON array of flashcards, each as: {"id": 1, "type": "mcq/basic/cloze", "front": "...", "back": "...", "bloom_level": "...", "scaffolding_layer": 1-4, "explanation_tags": ["NICE", "best_practice"]}. Ensure 10 per scaffolding layer, balanced types, rigorous distractors per protocol. Cards must be concise (under 200 words), optimized for spaced repetition (Anki-compatible).
